com.samysadi.acs.hardware.misc

Interface MemoryZone

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Cloneable, Entity, Notifier, Probed
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    RamZone, StorageFile, VirtualMemoryUnit<Zone,Unit>, VirtualRam, VirtualStorage
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    MemoryZoneImpl, RamZoneDefault, StorageFileDefault, VirtualMemoryUnitDynamic, VirtualMemoryUnitElastic, VirtualMemoryUnitFixedSize, VirtualMemoryUnitImpl, VirtualRamDynamic, VirtualRamElastic, VirtualRamFixedSize, VirtualStorageDynamic, VirtualStorageElastic, VirtualStorageFixedSize

    public interface MemoryZone
extends Entity
    You can associate for each MemoryZone one or more bitmaps describing the modified space of the memory zone.
    Since:
    1.0

    • Method Detail

      • clone

        MemoryZone clone()
        Description copied from interface: Entity
        Creates a clone of this entity and sets its parent to null.

        This is a deep clone method which also clones almost all children entities and sets their parents to the newly created clone. The only children which are not cloned are those implementing the UncloneableEntity interface.

        Implementations must ensure that the new clone will be independent from the current entity.

        Specified by:
        clone in interface Entity
        Specified by:
        clone in interface Notifier

        the parent of this entity, or null

      • getSize

        long getSize()
        Returns the size (in number of Simulator.BYTEs) taken by this zone on the parent memory unit.
        Returns:
        the size (in number of Simulator.BYTEs) taken by this zone on the parent memory unit

      • setSize

        void setSize(long newSize)
        Updates the size (in number of Simulator.BYTEs) of this zone and allocates/frees the difference in the parent memory unit.

        Throws a NotificationCodes.MZ_SIZE_CHANGED notification.

        Parameters:
        newSize - new size of the zone

      • getMetaData

        MetaData getMetaData()
        Returns a MetaData object representing the meta-data associated to this memory zone.

        This object may contain for example a filename, a file version_id, modification/creation dates etc.. It is left to the user discretion to choose which meta-data is important and should be saved for the simulation.

        Returns:
        a MetaData object representing the meta-data associated to this memory zone

      • setMetaData

        void setMetaData(MetaData metaData)
        Updates the meta-data associated with the current zone.
        A NotificationCodes.MZ_METADATA_CHANGED notification is also thrown.
        Parameters:
        metaData -

      • isReplicaOf

        boolean isReplicaOf(MemoryZone zone)
        Returns true if the given zone is the current zone or if it is a replica of the current zone.

        This method may be used, for instance, after migrations to find a replica for a particular memory zone in the new MemoryUnits of the new host.

        Default implementations uses getMetaData() to check if the two zones contains the same data:

        this.getMetaData().isSameData(zone.getMetaData());
        A special case if one of the meta-data is null, is to return false.
        Parameters:
        zone -
        Returns:
        true if the given zone is the current zone or if it is a replica of the current zone

      • getMemoryMap

        Bitmap getMemoryMap(Object id)
        Returns the user defined memory map with the given id.

        If none is set, then a new one is created such that it marks all the memory as dirty.

        Parameters:
        id -
        Returns:
        the user defined memory map with the given id

      • removeMemoryMap

        void removeMemoryMap(Object id)
        Removes the memory map that matches the given id.
        Parameters:
        id -

      • modify

        void modify(long pos,
          long size)
        Call this method to mark as modified the delimited area in this zone by pos (inclusive) and pos+size (exclusive).

        After calling this, all the memory maps inside of this memory zone are updated accordingly (the delimited memory is marked as dirty).
        Also, the MetaData related to this MemoryZone is updated accordingly (the zone's version is updated).

        A NotificationCodes.MZ_MODIFIED notification is also thrown.

        Parameters:
        pos - the position from which the modification starts
        size - the count of bytes that were modified (starting from pos)
